font.strong: Will students still be taking standardized tests? If so will the test window be adjusted? If so will the results still be used for evaluative purposes?
font.br: As of March 23, 2020, the Federal government released this statement. “The Michigan Department of Education (MDE) received preliminary approval over the weekend from the U.S. Department of Education to waive a number of federal requirements for statewide student testing and school accountability.”

br.span: At this time, we will wait for guidance from MDE, regarding what this means and how it will impact our district regarding the follow-up questions below.

br.strong: How does the extended closure impact the 3rd Grade Reading Law?

br.span: We are waiting for guidance at this time (3-26-2020).

span.strong: How does the extended closure impact teacher evaluation? Will 40% of teacher evaluations be based on assessment data?

br.span: We don’t know the answer to this question. The district is awaiting further guidance from the MDE or the Legislature.

br.strong: When will the school year-end? Will the mandated school closure be extended beyond April 5? Will the state forgive the lost days of instruction during the mandated school closure period?

br.span: As of March 26, 2020, in an address by Governor Whitmer, she indicated that her office, state legislators, MDE, superintendents, and others pertinent to these issues have been in meetings and conversations to address these questions. She mentioned that sometime in the next week or two, some guidance should be forthcoming.

br.strong: Will we still be offering summer school?

br.span: The district is unable to provide an answer to this question at this time. We will know more about summer school when the mandated school closure is over.
The district is unable to provide an answer to this question at this time. We will know more about graduation when mandated school closure is over.
The district is unable to provide an answer to this question at this time. We will know more about prom when mandated school closure is over.

br.strong: Does student learning that occurs during the mandated school closure period count?

br.span: Yes. All student learning counts. Teachers will continue to provide feedback to students. Feedback can take many forms, including grading.

br.strong: Will the school district continue to provide lunch meals during the Governor’s “Stay Home, Stay Safe” Executive Order?

br.span: Yes. Lunch meals will continue to be provided on a limited basis weekly. Please see the district’s website for days, times, and distribution locations.

span.strong: Will Tech support staff be available to assist students during the Governor’s “Stay Home, Stay Safe” Executive Order?

br.span: Yes. The technology staff have posted on the district’s website weekly hours they are available to assist students with technology needs.

span.strong: Several staff are participating in online professional development. Can this be counted towards DPPD?

br.br:
At this time, it may not qualify as our District DPPD, as we have our last 1/2 day DPPD on April 24, and if we are back in school, this would be the last of our DPPD required district hours. If we are not back in school, a plan for these hours will need to be addressed. However, any professional development done during this time can be counted toward license renewal. Attached are two documents addressing this area. If your professional learning falls into one of the categories listed on the Guidelines sheet, then you can count that under Section 1527.
Guidelines for Professional Learning
Education Related Professional Development
Are there any specific items that need to be communicated to parents in regards to FERPA and/or HIPPA if we move to online learning?
We are still working on providing a response to this question.
Do we need to have a signed consent for special education programs or any of the services such as speech, school social work, or audiology?
We are still working on providing a response to this question.
When can students pick up their personal items from lockers/classrooms?
When the "Stay at Home" Order has been lifted, the district will promptly determine and communicate a process for these items to be picked up.
When can Sylvester students pick up their fundraiser merchandise?
The fundraiser merchandise is still at the vendor's warehouse. Once the "Stay at Home" Order and any restrictions regarding essential workforce are lifted, the administration will work with the company to prioritize delivery to Sylvester. The distribution of the merchandise will be prioritized once the bans are lifted.
Are districts required to continue paying 3rd party staff?
This is a local decision; it's up to the local school district how they will continue to use 3rd party staff. As of April 6, Berrien Springs Public Schools will continue to pay all hourly staff.
Are districts allowed to ask contractors to continue working on school bond/construction projects?
Under the Governor's current "Stay Home" Executive Order, only essential contractors are allowed to work; essential would be defined as those contractors needed for necessary repairs or to sustain critical structure related to an ongoing project.
Will the State provide additional funding for summer school?
Summer school programming is a local district decision; the State has no plans to provide additional funding for summer school for the 2020 summer.
May school districts use a pass/fail system for seniors the remainder of the school year?
Yes, using grades or a pass/fail process for seniors is a local district decision. Additional information will be forthcoming in the district's soon to be released guidance document.
Are there any plans that would allow families to use a Bridge or EBT card to purchase meals?
MDE & DHHS have been working creatively and collaboratively to provide access to student meals. There is currently no such provision; however, there may be new guidance and information forthcoming from the State regarding this question.
Are school districts required to provide meals through the end of the school year or the end of June?
It is only through the end of the school year.
Will the State consider approval of unique uses of Title & 31A funds?
Yes, the State welcomes questions regarding the unique uses of Title & 31A funds for use during the pandemic.
Will the State reimburse local districts for damaged student devices or student devices not returned?Individual local district policy will cover these situations; there is no special state funding that will be made available for unreturned or damaged student devices.
Are districts required to conduct Teacher evaluations?
The state requirement to conduct teacher, administrator, and superintendent evaluations for 2019-20 is suspended.
May students be on the campus during this time?
The Governor's Order did provide some latitude for students/families to pick up devices or other technology to support remote learning as well as a provision to pick up learning packets and other instructional materials.
Are GSRP programs suspended?
The Governor's Order did not directly impact GSRP programs. Districts are required to pay these employees. Under the Governor's Order, school districts may redeploy these employees as the district's essential needs dictate.
Are "Continuity for Learning" plans required to include new learning, or may the learning include just opportunity for mastery of previous learning?
This is a local district decision. Additional information will be forthcoming in the district's soon to be released guidance document.
Will the State allow districts to run summer school?
The State will wait to see how long the "Stay Home" order extends. Summer school is a possibility as of today; however, the state nor local districts should make any commitments for face-to-face learning for the summer months at this time.
Will districts be required to submit SIPs and DIPs?
There has been no guidance from the Governor's Office yet. Michigan Association of Superintendents and Administrators (MASA) will work with the Michigan Department of Education (MDE) to provide districts with further guidance on this question.
Can current Professional Development be substituted for required 2020-21 PD?
MASA will look at the legality of this question; if this is legal, MASA may consider a lobby effort to make this permissible for districts. Additional information will be provided to school districts at a future date.
Can a student drive to a school building and remain in their car for the purpose of Internet access?
The Governor's Office is seeking legal clarity around this question and will provide school districts with information at a later date.
If the Governor's "Stay Home" order is extended, will districts be allowed to engage support staff in meaningful work?
There is currently no connection to "pay" and meaningful work in the Governor's current Executive Order. It is up to each local district to determine how to use support staff for essential work. Building principals will communicate with paraprofessionals if they are needed to engage in "essential" work for the district.
Are districts required to pay staff for Extra Duty pay?
The Governor's Executive Order does not require districts to make these payments. This is a local district decision. Additional information will be forthcoming from the district.
Will the REP submission be required for spring 2020?
There will likely still be a collection of reports required; however, evaluation data reporting will not be required.
